title: How to Make a Cranberry and German Chocolate Cheesecake

steps.headline: Butter a cake pan (diameter 24) including the walls of the pan.
Crush the biscuits in a blender until powdered form and mix them with melted butter.
Plug tray with biscuits in the oven for ten minutes, then remove it and let it cool.
To prepare cranberries, place them in a saucepan or frying pan along with the sugar, and orange zest.
Add rum.
steps.description: Then put the pan on the stove over low heat for 5 minutes. Stir from time to time. Take the pan off the heat and leave to cool composition.

steps.headline: Grab the cream cheese.
steps.description: Combine the sugar and corn flour. Add the cream cheese and mix well with a spoon.

steps.headline: Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each.
steps.description: Stir until the mixture is still fluffy. Add cream (unbeaten), vanilla pod, and seeds from the juice of an orange. Mix well with a spoon until all ingredients incorporate.

steps.headline: Take three quarters of composition cranberries and add them in the composition of cheese, stirring gently.
Put this mixture in pan Toet, covering biscuits.
steps.description: Move the pan slightly to even composition. Put remaining cranberries on top and push them gently with finger inside, but not all.

steps.headline: Place the tray in the center of the oven and bake for 40-45 minutes until cheesecake is slightly brown and the edges start to leave.
steps.description: If you see them brown too quickly on top, cover the edges of the pan with foil.

steps.headline: For the sauce, melt the chocolate in a bain marie and add cream, stirring well.
steps.description: Place sauce in a bag, break little bag at one end and pour it over the cheesecake.

steps.headline: After the time has elapsed, leave it to cool for 2-3 hours, but not before you decorate with some chocolate sauce on top.

text: Preheat the oven to 180 °F (82 °C).  Butter a cake pan (diameter 24) including the walls of the pan.  Crush the biscuits in a blender until powdered form and mix them with melted butter.  Plug tray with biscuits in the oven for ten minutes, then remove it and let it cool.  To prepare cranberries, place them in a saucepan or frying pan along with the sugar, and orange zest.  Add rum. Then put the pan on the stove over low heat for 5 minutes. Stir from time to time. Take the pan off the heat and leave to cool composition. Grab the cream cheese. Combine the sugar and corn flour. Add the cream cheese and mix well with a spoon. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each. Stir until the mixture is still fluffy. Add cream (unbeaten), vanilla pod, and seeds from the juice of an orange. Mix well with a spoon until all ingredients incorporate. Take three quarters of composition cranberries and add them in the composition of cheese, stirring gently. Add the chopped chocolate. Put this mixture in pan Toet, covering biscuits. Move the pan slightly to even composition. Put remaining cranberries on top and push them gently with finger inside, but not all. Place the tray in the center of the oven and bake for 40-45 minutes until cheesecake is slightly brown and the edges start to leave. If you see them brown too quickly on top, cover the edges of the pan with foil. For the sauce, melt the chocolate in a bain marie and add cream, stirring well. Place sauce in a bag, break little bag at one end and pour it over the cheesecake. After the time has elapsed, leave it to cool for 2-3 hours, but not before you decorate with some chocolate sauce on top.  Eat your cheesecake!
